result.execSummary:
The defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

letter to employer in regards to wage assignment

Defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe in court.   David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM93 had been dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion.
Review Hearing to be held on 15CM333 only.

8:25 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
The purpose of this hearing is that defendant had entered into an agreement to repay attorney fee's and Court needs to know where the defendant is
currently employed.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant is currently employed with Lands' End.
Defendant will need to execute a new wage assignment.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant ordered to go to the Clerk of Court's Office and set a new wage assignment for the $25/paycheck with Lands' End.
Review hearing on October 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on October 4, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe in court. 
Both files heard: 15CM93, 15CM333

Court questions the defendant re: employment. 
Defendant indicates he is not currently working.  He is looking for employment at this time.  

Court will set a review hearing for 2 weeks to review employment status at that time.  Review hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Review hearing on September 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Wage assignment returned - Terminated employment 03-31-16
(same as Order for Wage Assignment for Attorney Fees) WA code added to case.
for Wage Assignment for Attorney fees /s/TTF
Reminder Notice
Guilty on both counts

Defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:04 am. Court calls case.
Jury has not been brought in yet.
Atty Knaapen makes statements in regards to case law referred to yesterday.
Court indicates that there will be no change to charges.
9:11 am. Jurors are escorted into the courtroom.
Court welcomes Jurors and requests that the alternate Juror be selected.
Juror #1541 is excused.
Court gives Jury Instructions.
9:29 am. Atty Knaapen gives closing statements.
9:37 am. Atty Sheets gives closing statements.
9:55 am. Rebuttal by Atty Knaapen.
10:04 am. Court addresses the Jurors in regards to Verdict.
Bailiffs sworn by the Clerk.
Jurors are sent to deliberate.
Court reviews all of the Exhibits.
Atty Knaapen indicates that Exhibits #1-#4 be allowed to be sent to the Jurors.
Atty Sheets does not object to Exhibits #1-#4 to be sent to the Jurors.
Court sends the Exhibits mentioned to the Jury.
10:13 am. Court is now in recess.

11:30 am. Court is back in session.
Jurors are back in session.
Court reads the verdict.
Jury finds the defendant:
Guilty on both counts
Court polls the Jurors.

State motions the Court to enter judgment of conviction.

BY THE COURT:
Clerk is ordered to enter judgment of convition on both Cts 1 & 2.

Atty Sheets makes statements.
Defendant makes statements.
Court addresses defendant.

BY THE COURT:
$200 fine plus costs on each count
Pay victim witness, filing fee & DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample

20 days to appeal

Start payment plan if not available to pay
11:40 am. Court is in recess.
#8 Certified copy of Criminal Complaint from Portage County Case #15CM93
#7 Certified copy of Portage County Bail Bond on 15CM93
#6 Sauk County certified copy of criminal complaint
#5 Sauk County Bond Form Case #13CT419

#1 Policy and Procedure Agreement

Defendant Oluwagbenga B. Awe in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jurors that failed to appear today are 1490 and 1599.

8:44 a.m.  Court calls case.
Court provides a status of the case to all potential juror's.
Court introduces the parties to the juror's.
State will have one witness, Lana Eiden.
8:49 a.m.  Clerk administers the Voir Dire Oath.
**The following 23 potential jurors have been chosen:
1540, 1632, 1498, 1556, 1610, 1594, 1639, 1492, 1654, 1588, 1573, 1645, 
1541, 1563, 1605, 1514, 1638, 1552, 1646, 1657, 1568, 1613, 1620
8:54 a.m.  Court administers Voir Dire Oath.
9:07 a.m.  Atty Knaapen administers Voir Dire Oath.
9:16 a.m.  Atty Sheets administers Voir Dire Oath.  
9:39 a.m.  Attorney's exercise their peremptory strikes to get 13 jurors.
**The following 13 jurors chosen are:
1492, 1498, 1514, 1540, 1541, 1552, 1573, 1588, 1605, 1620, 1632, 1639, 1654
Jurors not chosen are excused from the Jury box and Court thank's them for their service and excuses them for the day.
9:56 a.m.  Clerk administers Jurors Oath.
Court reads instruction(s) regarding Juror's conduct during the Jury Trial.
10:06 a.m.  Juror's are excused until 1:00 p.m.  
Court is in recess.

Clerk:  ejp
1:05 p.m.  Court is back in session without the jurors. Attorney Sheets makes a statement to the court and provides the court with a document that he drafted.  
1:08 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.  Court reads instructions as to note taking.  
1:10 p.m.  ADA makes opening statement.
1:15 p.m.  Defense attorney makes opening statement.  
1:23 p.m.  Clerk swears in the witness. Prosecutor examines the witness.  Witness identifies the defendant.  Exhibit #1 is referred to.  
1:32 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  The court takes up an issue without the presence of the jurors.
1:40 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back in.  Direct examination continues by the prosecutor with referral to Exhibit #1, #2, #3 and #4 is referred to in direct examination.  
Court receives Exhibit #1 -4 as moved by the prosecutor.
1:56 p.m.  Clerk marks Exhibit #5, #6 and is referred to in direct examination by prosecution.
2:00 p.m.  Court receives Exhibits #5, 6, 7 and 8 without objections
Defense attorney cross examines the witness.  Refers to Exhibits #1, #2 and #3 in cross examination
2:23 p.m.  Redirect by prosecutor.  Refers to Exhibit #1
2:28 p.m.  Recross by defense attorney - refers to Exhibit #1
2:33 p.m.  Jurors are escorted out of the courtroom.  Court hears arguments by the attorneys.  
2:41 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back in.  Redirect by prosecutor.  Re-cross by Attorney Sheets.  
2:44 p.m.  Witness is allowed to step down and excused from her subpoena.  Court takes a short recess.  
3:00 p.m.  Same appearances as previous.  Jurors are not present in the courtroom.  The court collequy with the defendant. Court questions the attorney.
3:03 p.m.  The jurors are escorted into courtroom.  The state has rested and the defense is not going to present any evidence.  Court reminds the jurors to not discuss the case or research the case and are allowed to leave the courthouse.  Jurors excused until 3:30 p.m.  Court reviews proposed jury instructions with counsel.  
3:35 p.m.  Jurors are escorted back into the courtroom.   Court reminds the jurors of the instructions, no independent research, no google, no facebook and no discussion about the case outside of this courtroom.  No talking about the testimony or any questions about the matter.  
3:36 p.m.  Jurors are released for tonight and will return at 9:00 a.m. tomorrow.  
3:42 p.m.  Court continues to review the proposed jury instructions and verdict.  ---  CS court reporter
4:27 p.m.  court is adjourned.
